Well, although I didn't rack up much game time on this game, and that I didn't progress too far into the game, I can say the game is good but just barely. I don't know if it's that my computer(s) is/are compatible for the game or not, but I experience seriously bad lag, despite cranking down the settings all the way to low quality. Another bad experience is that when I equip my melee knife for battle, not trying to fight while in a shark's jaws, that my on-screen knife hand spazzes out far off the map and I have a hard time as to where to aim a stab at a shark. But, the good news is this: this game is very unique. SPOILER ALERT TO COD: GHOSTS! Skip this section if you want to, or read on.      'Bout a year ago when I was playing Call of Duty: Ghosts, there was a level called 'Into the Deep' and one part of the level was to get past a ring of sharks. Sound simple, right? WRONG! I died at LEAST 10 times before I decided to restart the level and follow the other character (Keegan) through the sharks.    I give credit to the COD wiki and the makers of COD. (Made this part so I don't get sued somehow.)      Anyways, back to Depth. The COD level traumatized me ever since. This game brings back that memory. And that memory always makes me sh*t my pants every time I think of it. Because you don't really know when the sharks will strike, you always have a feeling of fear knowing that the sharks can see you, but you can't see them. So, to save me time in describing this, and to make this more appealing to the eyes of the reader(s) of my review, I will make a pro's and con's list.  Pro's *Unique atmosphere *Price fits game *Large amount of weapons to use and abilities to unlock *Emphasizes use of tactics and teamwork *Easy-to-learn gameplay *Lots of fun *Updated often (As of the time of this current form of the review) *Growing community  Con's *Still has a few glitches (Maybe it's my computer[s]) *Have to put every setting to low or off to make sure my game doesn't crash (Again, maybe my computer)  Conclusion: This game is very well-done and reasonably priced. I expect to see great things come out of this game, and I will try to further enjoy the game.  Review date: 4/5/15 Sunday PLEASE NOTE: This is my first review, I apologize for if I didn't get the Formatting (i.e. Spoiler text) done right.

I only played a bit during a Free Weekend, but here's what I think.  The concept of asymmetric multiplayer appears to work. One team is the humans, exploring underwater ruins for treasure and escorting a robot to help them go deeper. The other team is the sharks, and they are demonstrating their position as apex predators of the ocean.  Not only is it asymmetric, but because it's set underwater, the Z axis gets far more attention than in any other team FPS. If you're coming in with experience from other games, be humble and get to know the play style you'll need to survive and succeed.  Both humans and sharks have the by now traditional experience-unlock system. Earn XP as a human and get access to more weapons and gear. Earn XP as a shark and get access to 'mutations' that beef up each species.  In short, if you're getting tired of running around shooting dudes, you can't go wrong with strapping on fins and diving into the ocean to test your mettle.

Pros - Exciting as all hell, keeps you on the edge. - 12 levels to play through keeps things pretty interesting. - graphics are pretty good - game is gory and i love that - great game to play with a group of friends - both sides are equally fun to play (Sharks, Divers) - lots of upgrades to collect through leveling and are used in gameplay which make things tougher as the match progresses   Cons - the game feels extremely unbalanced some of the times (most of the time) <- sharks are typically way over powered and it gets incredibly annoying - Seems as if it's not matching you to people at an equal level which makes certain matches extremely one sided. - Only two gameplays and it can get kind of boring sometimes - Finding some bugs that are annoying hopefully devs will jump on that soon - tons of keyboard smashing moments, attributed to the above mentioned problems, high chance of rage quitting due to constant loses either because your teams sucks shark a$$ for a living or the one shark you are playing with is a complete moron.  - Matchmaking is speratic, you could be instantly thrown into a lobby or be waiting 10 minutes to find a game. - The sharks in this game are extremely over powered and therefor the game is typically one sided, i can't stress this enough it is not like the divers cant kick some serious shark fin but the odds of you getting paired with people who actually have some sort of brain inside that wetsuit are so slim that you will spend most of your time raging on the inside at the sheer stupidity of your teammates, and the one sided battle against the sharks    Final opinion.  it's a fun game under the right circumstances, the amount of BS you are going to deal with in this game can get extremely frustrating, i suggest playing with a group of friends if possible or at least a couple of buddies, it will make the odds of getting crap teammates a lot slimmer, BUY THIS GAME ON SALE!!! <--- i can not stress this enough, the game is super bare bones, and unbalanced like a fat boy on a tight rope swinging side to side.

I've logged nearly 40 hours now, and I can say that I really like this game. But full disclosure, I don't mind playing essentially the same first-person shooter for 15 minute matches on one of 8 or so maps over and over again. I can be the diver or a shark, match play is quick, online multiplayer seems to work well, and gives me options to play with friends in the same match. the negative side of that would be the wait times between matches and a somewhat slow load in as individuals (all 6 of us if no bots) select our options.  Drops are a little too rare and sparse, which is a shame. It seems to really want to force you to paid skins and weapons, but the game can be enjoyed without those.   No real gameplay glitches or crashes that I've seen. On the whole, this short-attention span match style works for me. Course they had me at, 'you wanna be the shark and eat people?'

Game is pretty fun and quite terrifying at times when the sharks come out of the depths, no pun intended, and scare the living bajesus out of you and your friends. The bot AI is really good, almost too good, and the multiplayer online is fun, especially the megaladon hunt.  One thing preventing me from reccomending this whole heartedly is the automatic weapons they allow players to earn through gold pickups. They completely ruin the dynamic of divers escaping the sharks, with auto weapons its ambushing the sharks and widdling their lives down making it unfun/boring for the divers, and unfair/annoying to the sharks.  Other than that the game is really fun, but annoying at points, its a fun game if you get your friends together and play hide and seek and megaladon, but blood and gold is really annoying as it is right now.
